flow.descriptionCdata:
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.0446d087-06cc-4d6f-b359-133358a81bf4.prompt=Artifact ID 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.0f700327-870d-4747-a3d0-4cbd291bc431.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.
readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.1279db09-6d4c-428c-9702-3d491764b5ff.description=Reboot the given Server managed in SA. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. agent - Name of the server to reboot now. wait - An integer value specifying How many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the job created. 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.17a45264-d217-46a4-95ae-3bf4f662772d.description=
Updates timezone on Windows, RHEL and SUSE servers by using ad hoc SA scripts.

Inputs\:

osType - OS type of the server e.g Windows, SUSE, RHEL (windows and suse are used in comparisons)
server.name - hostname of the server
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.20ddd91b-f7b0-4a87-a2b8-b005e7839f7d.callout=RHEL 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.2726fea7-107e-404b-905e-fd648b0729f3.prompt=User Identifier 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.289c88c9-40ce-4f32-9ff5-dc29976ddc56.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.31b5405a-bf48-4a23-a2fe-72eda4f4b8c1.description=Waits for the job to reach a specific state. If no state is specified, then this will wait for the job to reach an end state. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. jobID - The id of the job. status - The status to wait for the job to reach. If none is specified this will wait until the job is no longer running. timeout - The maximum number of milliseconds to wait for the job. If not specified, 1 hour is used. frequency - The frequency, in milliseconds, with which the operation will check if the job has reached the specified state (or an end state). The default value is 5000 ms. Responses\: failure - Something went wrong. success - The operation completed successfully. 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.4520f974-731e-41c0-b916-af170876facd.description=Adds a custom attribute to a specific object (object can be of type\: SERVERS, DEVICE_GROUPS, SOFTWARE_POLICIES, CUSTOMERS). Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. attachedToType - The type of the objectto which the Custom Attribute is attached to (must be one of [SERVERS, DEVICE_GROUPS, SOFTWARE_POLICIES, CUSTOMERS]. attachedToName - The name of the object to which the Custom Attribute is attached to (e.g. name of server or device group, short name of customer etc). attachedToID - The id of the object to which the Custom Attribute is attached to (e.g. id of server or device group etc). Use this input for unique identification. name - The name of the attribute. value - The value of the attribute. Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.49c69cb0-3964-4de5-b68f-ea13c8a2fed4.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.52e1b25f-d9bb-4567-aab1-d53e8ebd18c3.description=
This operation adds a flow variable to the local context. The variable is available in the current flow and its child flows.

Inputs\:
    keyName - The name of the flow variable to add.
    myValue - The value to assign to the flow variable.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of "myValue" input field.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.

Note\:
   If a flow variable with the same name already exists, its value will be overwritten.
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.5536e1d1-6969-469a-b3b7-cdaa5c117ad1.prompt=To Match\: 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.57e33db5-8915-4971-a5e2-67c28fe9fb87.prompt=User Identifier 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.5937aa86-8323-49fd-aa5f-44bc9bfbd861.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.59b15955-87f0-49fd-a61f-4aa638ab3be1.prompt=User Identifier 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.66e259d6-0064-493a-a28f-323e91a4834e.prompt=To Match\: 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.6bc09126-f236-49f1-aef1-cc6784d0a5a8.description=Waits for the job to reach a specific state. If no state is specified, then this will wait for the job to reach an end state. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. jobID - The id of the job. status - The status to wait for the job to reach. If none is specified this will wait until the job is no longer running. timeout - The maximum number of milliseconds to wait for the job. If not specified, 1 hour is used. frequency - The frequency, in milliseconds, with which the operation will check if the job has reached the specified state (or an end state). The default value is 5000 ms. Responses\: failure - Something went wrong. success - The operation completed successfully. 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.80171b35-ce7c-4e42-94bd-ea3018e53867.prompt=User Identifier 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.83b75254-417a-48b8-b06e-57abe56564f1.prompt=Process Instance ID 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.86af254c-108c-4388-b105-89062f5ef1bb.description=70b893d6-e51e-4763-82b7-4387620e9de1.75090c32-8685-4971-b0b4-a4bdd9a1a371.description 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.878eebe4-74df-40d3-b4a9-bc0497743708.prompt=Process Instance ID 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.89f41d28-5254-47c6-8d2e-a430d3c1e62c.description=
This operation loops as many times as specified in the "count" input, counting from "1" to a greater number, incrementing it by "1" at each iteration.

Inputs\:
    count - The number of loops to complete.
Valid values\: from 1 to 9223372036854775807
    reset - Specifies whether the counter restarts counting from "1".
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    to - The number to count to. It will take the value of the "count" input field. 
    from - The number to start counting at. For this operation, it is customized to "1".
    incrementBy - The number to increment by while counting. For this operation, it is customized to "1".

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the value of the number that was just counted.

Responses\:
    has more – The counting process is not complete. One or more iterations are pending.
    no more – The counting process is complete.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
1. It is recommended that you do not change the values of the "to", "from" or "incrementBy" input fields.
2. The "from", "to" and "incrementBy" inputs are customized for this operation. Even though you can also customize them, if you need to specify the loop range borders and the increment value, use the "Counter" operation.

Examples\:
1. For a loop with 20 iterations, the following values should be provided for the input fields\:
    count\: 20
    reset\: false (this field can also be left blank, as "false" is the default value)
2. For an infinite loop, the value of "count" should be at least "1" and the value of "reset" should be "true".
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.9d7139c4-2a19-4a8f-9867-c839050b60bd.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:

port - port smtp service is listening

subject - email subject

htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.

attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.9d8d7a68-e9ab-42d2-80f0-6ec0e07ac841.callout=Suse 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.9d9576ba-0b3a-4b97-aa03-8deeb52f5260.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.9fbff039-847b-4696-851b-67237e560dc9.description=server.os\: Windows or UNIX 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.a0dfe2ed-1a0b-4c15-a671-d3965881dd98.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.a1bfa504-87f9-4654-bf62-6a6cface2425.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
    string1 - The first string. 
Default value\: "" (empty)
    string2 - The second string.
Default value\: "" (empty)
    ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

Responses\:
    true - If the two strings are equal.
    false - If the two strings are not equal.
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.a62b5529-6184-4e9c-95cc-e14746e7edc0.prompt=Resource Provider ID 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.a95d1f8d-f836-4f94-8b9d-7d369fbfba96.prompt=70b893d6-e51e-4763-82b7-4387620e9de1.04e6f5c5-a060-4159-90d6-56dd66b0c2d1.prompt 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.acd42c83-cbd5-4598-b1b7-c09cac198ad5.prompt=User Identifier 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.b44e16fe-159a-4f40-a049-3e4f5f523da2.description=Adds a custom attribute to a specific object (object can be of type\: SERVERS, DEVICE_GROUPS, SOFTWARE_POLICIES, CUSTOMERS). Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. attachedToType - The type of the objectto which the Custom Attribute is attached to (must be one of [SERVERS, DEVICE_GROUPS, SOFTWARE_POLICIES, CUSTOMERS]. attachedToName - The name of the object to which the Custom Attribute is attached to (e.g. name of server or device group, short name of customer etc). attachedToID - The id of the object to which the Custom Attribute is attached to (e.g. id of server or device group etc). Use this input for unique identification. name - The name of the attribute. value - The value of the attribute. Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.b4f7dab0-a93d-468b-9f67-20c3aaf6b44f.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.b7edf747-63d6-4af7-a40b-75e6a4e2cc5e.prompt=Process Instance ID 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.bda3fe3a-c2e1-4629-85ec-2535b654ffba.description=
Pings the target computer from a Windows host computer.

Input Parameters\:
host 		- The hostname or IP address of the host computer to ping from.
user 		- Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank). The user to authenticate as.
password 		- Password of the user.
target 		- The target computer to ping.
packets 		- The number of packets to send to the target computer.
packetSize 		- The size of packets to send to the target computer.
command 		- DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE.
characterSet 	- The character encoding of the target computer. The default is RAS machine's default encoding.
outputPath 		- A network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible it should be changed to use another share that the local system account on the host computer has write-access to. By default, the path must be changed on Windows 2000 computers.

Responses\:
success 		- The target computer responded to all ping requests.
failure 		- The target computer did not respond to any ping request.
diagnosed		- The target computer responded only to some ping requests.
Connection Error	- The host computer could not be found or user credentials supplied to connect to it are incorrect.
Unknown Target	- The target computer could not be resolved to an IP address.

Result\:
The output of the ping operation.

Extra Results\:
returnResult		- The raw output of the Ping operation.
address 		- The actual IP address of the target computer.
% Packet Loss 	- The percentage of packets that ping replies were not received for.
average latency	- The average ping response time in milliseconds.
max latency 		- The maximum response time of all the ping reqeusts (in milliseconds).
min latency 		- The minimum number of milliseconds that was taken to receive a ping response.

Note\: If an encoding is not given by user, the batch file will be created using the RAS machine's default encoding,
That may cause to corruption in a case where remote machine's encoding is different than the RAS machine's one.
In that case,user must define the appropriate 'characterSet'
The character encoding specified in the input for characterSet must not be Unicode (ex. UTF-8, UTF-16).
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.bf8cceb3-7ee1-4e85-9272-74b082e79b1f.prompt=To Match\: 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.c7957329-5a5b-4f71-9c9c-1dbd6fb5463b.description=Waits for the job to reach a specific state. If no state is specified, then this will wait for the job to reach an end state. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. jobID - The id of the job. status - The status to wait for the job to reach. If none is specified this will wait until the job is no longer running. timeout - The maximum number of milliseconds to wait for the job. If not specified, 1 hour is used. frequency - The frequency, in milliseconds, with which the operation will check if the job has reached the specified state (or an end state). The default value is 5000 ms. Responses\: failure - Something went wrong. success - The operation completed successfully. 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.cb1ba0c7-06f7-41f5-8981-20f19dccaa8c.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.cbc8e328-823d-4eb9-b94c-a92a53cbd2ae.description=Reboot the given Server managed in SA. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the job created. 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.cd36c2c0-69a8-4de0-8ac2-7a0f43068651.description=

7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.d1a35ace-2890-48f3-bfb2-15f1093af1f2.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.e3388fc9-19dc-4feb-ba4b-ba6893f73f71.description=Reboot the given Server managed in SA. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. agent - Name of the server to reboot now. wait - An integer value specifying How many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the job created. 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.e3a86a18-34c7-472b-8eb1-48d8c35f2fa4.prompt=Process Instance ID 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.ed056e1d-6ede-4be2-b792-534c160ff123.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.
readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.ee4491f8-7e97-42aa-8924-a44fa5d0310b.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.f1b45dc9-b7cc-40c4-9ed8-2015710c5129.prompt=User Identifier 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.f2933285-7591-489f-9e8e-ae56a61d5318.prompt=70b893d6-e51e-4763-82b7-4387620e9de1.0ce5f99d-6acf-4904-9c04-1587e4685ee5.prompt 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.f70c5579-b180-4c64-bf9e-335d2d29e04e.prompt=User Identifier 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.fadb1955-981f-47f6-b2f6-5aa39ff49328.description=
This operation adds a flow variable to the local context. The variable is available in the current flow and its child flows.

Inputs\:
    keyName - The name of the flow variable to add.
    myValue - The value to assign to the flow variable.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of "myValue" input field.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.

Note\:
   If a flow variable with the same name already exists, its value will be overwritten.
7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.fba1e6d0-b281-4b27-a9ac-cad22299b928.prompt=Process Instance ID 7e77417a-d2b7-4a2c-912c-cf0c3f9f3305.fd25e8ab-066c-4e2b-8227-b8bdba764694.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State
flow.name: VPC - Post Deploy Linux

step.name: Send Mail to Support for Backup

staticBinding.value: MTC LNX: Request RTPA & Register in NETIQ for ${server.name}.${MTC/MTC-dns-domain}

The following MTC server has been provisioned:
Hostname: ${server.name}
NAT IP: ${server.publicIP}
Backup IP: ${server.privateIP}
Username: ${server.username}
Password: ${server.password}

Please carry out the following tasks:

1. Start the RTPA process.
2. Register server in NetIQ Agent Manager.

LOGDATE=$(date +%Y%m%d) cp -p /etc/services /etc/services.${LOGDATE} if [ "$?" != "0" ]; then echo "Could not create backup of /etc/services. Terminating!" exit 1 fi
sed "s/^personal-agent/#personal-agent/g" /etc/services.${LOGDATE} > /etc/services
if [ $(grep -c "^#personal-agent" /etc/services) = "2" ]; then echo "Successfully hashed out the personal-agent services" exit 0 else echo "ERROR: Could not hash out the two expected entries of personal-agent!" exit 2 fi

Your MTC Server has been provisioned.



Hostname: ${server.name}.${MTC/MTC-dns-domain}
Public IP: ${server.publicIP}
CSA ID: ${SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID}



Regards,
The MTC Support Team

if [ $(grep -c "^#BUR SERVERS" /etc/hosts) != "0" ]; then echo "BUR servers seem to be already defined in /etc/hosts. Please check!" exit 1 else cp -p /etc/hosts /etc/hosts.$(date +%Y%m%d) || exit 2 cat >>/etc/hosts << EOF
